text: As the economic depression deepened in the early 30s, and as farmers had less and less money to spend in their town, banks began to fail at alarming rates. In all, 9,000 banks failed during the decadeof the 30s. Itâ€™s estimated that 4,000 banks failed during the one year of 1933. By 1933, depositors watched alarmingly as $140 billion disappearthrough bank failures.
